TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Grid extends Xamarin.Forms.Layout`1<class Xamarin.Forms.View> implements class Xamarin.Forms.IElementConfiguration`1<class Xamarin.Forms.Grid>, class Xamarin.Forms.IGridController
type Grid = class inherit Layout<View> interface IGridController interface IElementConfiguration<Grid>

Docs.summary: A layout that arranges views in rows and columns.

example.para: The following example shows a basic use:

remarks.para: The following shows Grids on the various platforms:

It is convenient for the layout class to store row and column indices of each of its child elements. Additionally, when a element is laid out with a grid, application developers can access and change the child's position and span from the child itself by using the , , , , static methods, and the equivalent static methods for columns and column spans.
The documentation for the following member methods contains XAML syntax examples:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Grid class.
Gets the collection of child elements of the Grid.

remarks.para: Application developers can use implicit collection syntax in XAML to add items to this collection, because this property is the ContentPropertyAttribute for the Grid class.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ColumnDefinitions : Xamarin.Forms.ColumnDefinitionCollection with get, set

Docs.summary: Provides the interface for the bound property that gets or sets the ordered collection of objects that control the layout of columns in the .
Docs.value: A ColumnDefinitionCollection for the Grid instance.

remarks.para: ColumnDefinitions is an ordered set of ColumnDefinition objects that determine the width of each column. Each successive ColumnDefintion controls the width of each successive column. If ColumnDefinitions is empty, or if there are more columns than definitions, then columns for which there is no definition are rendered as if they were controlled by a ColumnDefinition object that has its property set to .
The property has XAML syntax support. The syntax for this operation is shown below.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty ColumnDefinitionsProperty

Docs.summary: Implements the property, and allows the class to bind it to properties on other objects at run time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty ColumnProperty

Docs.summary: Implements the attached property that represents the zero-based column index of a child element. See Remarks.

remarks.para: The interface for this property is defined by the and methods.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ColumnSpacing : double with get, set

Docs.summary: Provides the interface for the bound property that gets or sets the distance between columns in the Grid.
Docs.value: The space between columns in this layout.

remarks.para: The property does not control spacing on the left and right edges of the layout. Application developers can control the spacing around the outside of the layout by setting the property of the visual element to which it belongs.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty ColumnSpacingProperty

Docs.summary: Implements the property, and allows the class to bind it to properties on other objects at run time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty ColumnSpanProperty

Docs.summary: Implements the attached property that represents the number of columns that a child element spans. See Remarks.

remarks.para: The interface for this property is defined by the and methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 GetColumn(class Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject bindable) cil managed

Docs.param: An element that belongs to the Grid layout.
Docs.summary: Gets the column of the child element.
Docs.returns: The column that the child element is in.

remarks.para: The method corresponds to the value that is set by the following XAML attached property.

description.para: An integer that represents the Column in which the item will appear.

remarks.para: The remarks for the method contain syntax for and information about the Column attached property.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.RowDefinitions : Xamarin.Forms.RowDefinitionCollection with get, set

Docs.summary: Provides the interface for the bound property that gets or sets the collection of RowDefinition objects that control the heights of each row.
Docs.value: A RowDefinitionCollection for the Grid instance.

remarks.para: RowDefinitions is an ordered set of objects that determine the height of each row. Each successive RowDefintion controls the width of each successive row. If RowDefinitions is empty, or if there are more rows than definitions, then rows for which there is no definition are rendered as if they were controlled by a RowDefinition object that has its property set to .

MemberSignature.Value: member this.RowSpacing : double with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space left between rows in the Grid. This is a bindable property.

remarks.para: The property does not control spacing on the top and bottom edges of the layout. Application developers can control the spacing around the outside of the layout by setting the property of the visual element to which it belongs.
